summary: The Indus River is a long river that flows through Asia, starting in Tibet and ending in Pakistan, where it meets the Arabian Sea. It's one of the world's 50 largest rivers and has a big drainage area. The river starts in mountains, fed by springs and glaciers, and passes through different landscapes. It's important for many cultures and has a rich history, including the ancient Indus Valley Civilization. The river's name is known in many ancient texts and has been explored by people since ancient times.
title: Indus River
